Class CashRegisterUSDToEuro

java.lang.Object
CashRegisterUSDToEuro
public class CashRegisterUSDToEuro
extends java.lang.Object
CashRegisterClass

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int conversionRate
    Final instance data member conversion rate of type int, which is the value in Euro Cents of 1000 US cents, when the program is used this can be change according to the conversion rate at the time of usage, this is declared as an instance variable in order for it to be easier to change for the user
    private java.lang.String displayChangeInEuroUnits
    Instance data member of type String that will hold the string to be displayed after computation with the change amount in Euros and the Euro bills and coins to be given to costumer

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    CashRegisterUSDToEuro()
    CashRegister no parameter constructor that initializes the displayChangeInEuroUnits to an empty string

    method to change a passed in US cents amount to Euro cents using the instance variable conversionFactor (edit the variable on its definition in case the conversion factor has changed) if the conversion was not exact, one cent was added to the Euro cents value

    method to check what bills and coins need to be givento user, if any value of that unit needs to be given to costumer, the methods adds the value with proper formating to the displayChangeInEuro to let the user know what number of that bill or coint they need to give to costumer

  • Field Details

    • conversionRate

      private final int conversionRate
      Final instance data member conversion rate of type int, which is the value in Euro Cents of 1000 US cents, when the program is used this can be change according to the conversion rate at the time of usage, this is declared as an instance variable in order for it to be easier to change for the user

    • sumTotalUSCentsPaid

      public int sumTotalUSCentsPaid​(int twentyDollars, int tenDollars, int fiveDollars, int oneDollar, int twentyFiveCents, int tenCents, int fiveCents, int oneCent)
      sumTotalUSCentsPaid method to add up all the bills and coins the costumer paid with and get the total amount in US cents
      Parameters:
      twentyDollars - number of twenty dollar bills the costumer paid with
      tenDollars - number of ten dollar bills the costumer paid with
      fiveDollars - number of five dollar bills the costumer paid with
      oneDollar - number of one dollar bills the costumer paid with
      twentyFiveCents - number of quarters the costumer paid with
      tenCents - number of dimes the costumer paid with
      fiveCents - number of nickels the costumer paid with
      oneCent - number of pennies the costumer paid with
      Returns:
      int with the total amount the costumer paid with in US cents

    • totalPriceInCents

      public int totalPriceInCents​(java.lang.String dollarAmount)
      method that takes in the price of the item as a string and then changes that value to an int with the total value in US Cents. the method changes the whole dollars before the point (if there is a point) into int and turns the dollars into cents and whats after t the point is also changed into an int but now just added to the previous obtained cents, this way getting the total value in cents.
      Parameters:
      dollarAmount - string with the item price
      Returns:
      int holding the price of the item in USCents

    • changeFromUSToEuroCurrency

      public int changeFromUSToEuroCurrency​(int centsUS)
      method to change a passed in US cents amount to Euro cents using the instance variable conversionFactor (edit the variable on its definition in case the conversion factor has changed) if the conversion was not exact, one cent was added to the Euro cents value
      Parameters:
      centsUS - the amouont of US cents that needs to be converted into Euro cents
      Returns:
      the value of the US cents in Euro cents

    • amountToReturn

      public java.lang.String amountToReturn​(int totalCents)
      method to change the value of the totalCents to be given, into normal convention of whole Euros and cents instead of just the cents
      Parameters:
      totalCents - the amount of cents to be given to the costumer
      Returns:
      string holding the quantity in normal currency convention (whole unit point cents)

    • displayUnitsOfChangeInEuroCurrency

      public java.lang.String displayUnitsOfChangeInEuroCurrency​(int totalChangeInCents, int twentyBills, int tenBills, int fiveBills, int oneBills)
      method that will determine the amount of each bill or coin to be given to costumer according to the change that needs to be returned and to the bills paid with, to give back the unit bills the user paid with if possible, if not then just check what units to return according to the change that is left
      Parameters:
      totalChangeInCents - total change in Euro cents to be returned
      twentyBills - number of twenty dollar bills the costumer paid with
      tenBills - number of ten dollar bills the costumer paid with
      fiveBills - number of five dollar bills the costumer paid with
      oneBills - number of one dollar bills the costumer paid with
      Returns:
      string holding the instructions of what bills or coins to return to give to costumer

    • determineUnits

      public int determineUnits​(int totalCents, int noOfUnit, int valueInCents)
      method used in displayUnitsOfChangeInEuroCurrency method to determine what bills should be given to user, according to the bills they paid with.
      Parameters:
      totalCents - total Euro cents of change left
      noOfUnit - no of that specific bill the user paid with
      valueInCents - value in cents of the specific bill
      Returns:
      number of bills that should be given to user according to what they first paid with

    • checkUnits

      public void checkUnits​(java.lang.String Unit, int unitNumber)
      method to check what bills and coins need to be givento user, if any value of that unit needs to be given to costumer, the methods adds the value with proper formating to the displayChangeInEuro to let the user know what number of that bill or coint they need to give to costumer
      Parameters:
      Unit - string that holds the name of the bill or coin to check
      unitNumber - number of that bill or coin that was used

    • computeChange

      public void computeChange​(java.lang.String price, int twentyDollarBills, int tenDollarBills, int fiveDollarBills, int oneDollarBills, int quarters, int dimes, int nickels, int pennies)
      method that gets called when you want to use the CashRegister class. Pass in the price of the item in USD and the amount of each bill and coin that the costumer paid with. The method will compute the change to return to user and convert it to Euro currency, then display the Euro bills or coins that need to be given to costumer for the change, if possible the program will give back the unit bills the costumer paid with. If the change conversion from USD to Euro is not exact, the program will go over the smallest Euro unit, one cent , to avoid any loss for the costumer.
      Parameters:
      price - string holding the item price in USD, the price should be entered with a decimal point if it includes cents
      twentyDollarBills - int holding the number of twenty dollar bills paid with
      tenDollarBills - int holding the number of ten dollar bills paid with
      fiveDollarBills - int holding the number of five dollar bills paid with
      oneDollarBills - int holding the number of one dollar bills paid with
      quarters - int holding the number of quarters paid with
      dimes - int holding the number of dimes paid with
      nickels - int holding the number of nickels paid with
      pennies - int holding the number of pennies paid with
